Digital signatures utilize public-key cryptography to verify the authenticity and integrity of digital messages or documents. A private key is used to sign the data, and a public key is used to verify the signature, ensuring the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.

mainEntity.name: How do blockchain and digital signatures enhance security?

acceptedAnswer.text: Blockchain and digital signatures enhance security through decentralization, cryptographic techniques, anonymity, and resistance to tampering. mainEntity.name: What are some applications of blockchain and digital signatures?

acceptedAnswer.text: Applications include financial services (cryptocurrencies, smart contracts), supply chain management (authenticating transactions), healthcare (securing electronic health records), digital identity (identity verification), and voting systems (secure and tamper-proof record keeping).
